The old woman rips a YELLOW TICKET from a pad, gives it to White.  A number on it.  She points her crooked finger again at a SPEAKER BOX above a small serving window in the wall.  A greenish fluoro pulses from the room within.
Keep newspapers here, birth certificates, records of deaths, that kind of thing?
It is?...  Which area is that number listed in?...  Is that near the ocean?...  The ocean...  Never mind.
I need something to keep me awake.
The city.  I need to get to the ocean.
The silhouette on the other side of the box leans forward.
Just let me sit here for a moment?
Shut up!  Listen.  Walk out quietly.
What do you want?  Tell me!
I want to see the doctor.  It's important.
Look!  Tell him I'm here.  Now.
You think I haven't been trying!
It's like there was never anything there.
Waves...  A beach.  A woman whispering.  That's all.
I need to stay awake.  Do you have any pills?
Asks my name.  Over and over.  Just like a broken record.  Only thing is, I can't answer.  I've no idea what my name is.
That's what people keep telling me.
Yeah well, why don't I ask some questions for a change.
You're supposed to be my doctor, right?
I told you, I can't remember a thing!
Did she drown?  The woman you told me about?
Can I get my life back?
Just the typical fabrications of a distorted mind.  You know, chased by mysterious men in black, that kind of thing...
What am I doing in here then?
So you're telling me the truth this time?  Is that it!
Do I look like a murderer to you?
Who is this?  What do you know about me?
I thought it would make more sense.
How do you know I'm innocent?
I can't do that.  It's dangerous.
How do I get there?  Tell me.
I  -  ah - couldn't think of anything else to do.  I thought maybe you know something...
I woke up in a subway.  I don't know how I got there.
I don't know who they are.
you can kill them.  They're not people  -  like us  -  got insects in their heads...  Got any disinfectant?
It's my legs.  Been bitten.  Giving me trouble.
No.  Nothing I can think of.
Well.  The only thing I've been certain of, all this time, is that I need to get to the ocean.  The point is no one seems to know how to get there.
Where do you think this goes?
I'll go see an uncle of mine.
Five  -  one  -  eight  -  three  -  double six  -  three...
Oh, it's you...  Yes...  My uncle apparently...  Just looking at some memories...  You have?  That's good.
There.  Behind the cabinet.  Where does it go?
How did you know where to find me?
My parents are supposed to be dead!
You have invented all this.  History is a lie, not just mine, everyone's  -
Everyone has a job  -  a function.  Each one teaches you more about your invention.  I'm what is called a murderer.
You've given everybody memories, but I missed out.  The Doctor saw to that -  played your own game.  And now...
You're trying to get rid of me.
Why do I threaten you?  You're scared aren't you?
I know, sir, but I can't make it at nine-thirty...  It's  -  um  -  well, inconvenient...
Germs, sir.  These places are full of them.
of tea would be good.  Milk and no sugar.
These are the investigations of a madman.  He has fabricated an entire bizarre paranoid delusion with no internal logic whatever.
This is a mess.  A horrible mess.
Do you wash your hands before you type things?
A formality.  I need to speak with Thompson.  Officially I need your written permission.
A hunch.  He might be able to...
Actually, I was wondering, sir, if you could let me have a few uniforms, to follow up for me...
How long have you been here?
I'm curious?  How many so far?
The six year old.  Sure, you remember.
Y'know, the kid you left in the meat packing plant, cut into pieces.
You sure have demonstrated a great deal of...  imagination.  The baby was the best though.  Several cops lost their lunch over that one.  Head twisted off, spine pulled out, yeech...
We count seven so far.  Anyone we missed?
Bumstead.  I'm here to see my mother.
Really?  And how is his state of mind?
You seem a little edgy.  Everything okay?
To tell you the truth, I'm glad we've run into each other like this.  Maybe you can help me tidy some loose ends.
This is highly irregular.  I have a right to know.
Yes, sir.  I'm sorry...  But I don't understand how it was possible.  The only window was twenty feet up a vertical wall, he was cuffed...
I'm on the serial killer case, need to talk.
You don't look so well...  C'mon, let me in Thompson.
Jesus!  We have to get you to a doctor...
But...  How long has this been happening?
It's alright.  I won't hurt you.
This is Bumstead.  Who is this?
I need everything on the Jonathan White case.
All the important stuff.  Wrap it up for me.
That was a pretty good escape act at the station.  How did you do that?
Please.  Not that way.  If you could just follow the covering  -  the carpet gets stained and it's impossible to clean.
Everything the department knows about John White is in this.  Here.
You're case has been driving me crazy.  You see, I pride myself on being thorough.  There's too many loose ends with your case.
Thought it was best you were hidden until we understand more about the facts.  What do you know about these men in black?
Careful with your trousers.  That stuff stains.
Any idea what part the Doctor plays in this business?
Let's try and find out, shall we.

I didn't tell you the entire reason I helped you.  It started with two little girls.  Twins.  Used to play with them when I was young.  Couldn't remember for the life of me what they looked like, then I understood why...
That's right.  Just seamless flesh across the front of their heads.  No mistake.  I just hadn't remembered it that way.  Up until then they had been normal little girls in my memory.
That's not all.  Once I started examining them, all sorts of things about my life, had...
Everything was liquid beneath a thin surface that had always seemed solid to me...
Is there anything you haven't told me about this business?  Even the most insignificant thing?
We'll get to the bottom of this.  I mean it.
I met a friend of yours the other night, doctor.  Tall fellow.  No hair.  Rather pale skin...
That's surprising.  He was leaving your office at the time...
I think it's time you introduced us to your little friends.
The Eye  -  um  -  delicious with horseradish on rye!
Was that for real down there?
This ocean business...  I know where I can find a map.  I need to go back to the station.  Where will you be?

At first I thought there was no way to get to the ocean...  The buildings are a barrier, no windows, no doors -  everything just, well, ends  -  only thing would be drill a hole.  But then, I saw it, one door, just one...
We can meet later  -  but first I have to do something.  Look I got to go...
Co-operate.  Do not make this difficult.
You will not shoot, yes.  There is a place in your mind, a corner of darkness...
Do not make us hurt you...
The line of junction between two edges!
We have located him.  Now is the time, yes.
You will obey us, yes.  In your mind there is a dark space...
We knew you would turn up here eventually...  Been waiting for you, yes.  Hoped you wouldn't make a nuisance of yourself on the way...
The handiwork of an extremely sick individual.
go on.  We know nothing about him, except that he likes to cut them...
Why are you wearing that thing on your face?
case is yours.  Go through his files.
Why do you want to speak to him?
What makes you think that!  If you would learn to concentrate on facts, not get so side-tracked  -  you might get things done faster, Bumstead...
I need to speak to you.  Immediately.
Bumstead, these...  er, gentlemen are here to collect White.
Yes.  That's right.  He's ill  -  he needs expert help.
If you could show them to the holding cell now.
How could you have been so stupid?
Bumstead, you're starting to annoy me.  This case is very important to me.  Just a little warning:  I've got my eye on you inspector, remember that.

Why do you always have to find things out the hard way!  Couldn't you just do your job, you idiot?  I told you, didn't I?  These people are not playing games, Bumstead.  They can do anything they want, don't you understand?
In a way, we all are, inspector!
Time for that early retirement, Bumstead.  Didn't bring the gold watch I'm afraid.
And who the hell are you?
Over there.  Numbers eight to twelve.
Please believe me.  It's me, John.
What is your name...  What is your name...
Says he is the man's doctor...
All the same entry wounds.  It's definitely him.
She lives...  lived here.  A prostitute.
This is the family of the victim  -
Well, sir...  I don't know exactly.
Fredrick steps back, a sigh of relief.  A shadow falls across his back.  He turns.  He screams.
White is standing in a bare room, in front of a finger-printing machine.  He's alone.  A blast of electrical FEED-BACK.  White looks up at a speaker mounted to the wall.
He cuts into the hand of one of the Men holding him, SPINS AND DRIVES the scalpel into the forehead of the Mystery Man attempting to hypnotise him.
The container crashes into the ground, crushing the creature.
White rounds a corner, stops, notices a small rectangular HOLE in a wall.  ANOTHER SCREAM, weaker now  -  He runs to the hole in the wall and looks through.
The Chief-Inspector thought you might need a hand.
as I believe you instructed.  All clear now, sir.  They found several more traps and things were filed under pretty strange categories...
Yes, sir.  The Chief-Inspector said he would see you now.
Won't say.  Says he must talk to you.
Mmm-hmm.  Stairs at the end of the hall.  Third floor.  Turn left.
She blows her nose into a handkerchief.  The snort ECHOES LOUDLY.
Just reminding you...  your eight pee em...
Looks like you need a haircut to me.
Only two bucks.  Shave as well...
Tell you what  -  let me cut yer hair, give ya watcha need half price.
Nope.  No maps.  Ocean, huh?  On vacation?
Grandpa thought customers might like some mood music.
complain.  Heh.  The erector set still works good.
glasses.  He puts the phone down, sits quietly at his desk, staring into space, lost in thought.
Beware!  The night is deadly.  There is a criminal among us.
It could be she!  The innocent across the street!
Or mister nervy stranger at the back!
You are thinking it could be anyone?
Then we must call the police.
I see.  Then who is after you?  What sins have you committed?
I'm sorry.  I told you, she is being examined...
You remember nothing?  Who you are?
Ah, that would be cheating, wouldn't it?
Is there nothing you remember?  Not even a detail?   You must try.
What does she say?  The woman.
That's right.  I am your doctor.
I cannot say...  You don't know the answer to that?
We won't get anywhere like this.

Put simply...  a penetration of the left parieto-occipital area of the cranium...  complicated by inflammation that resulted in adhesions of the brain to the meninges.  Without going into detail...  the formation of scar tissue altered the configuration of the lateral ventricles, producing incipient atrophy of the medulla...
I'm sorry.  I get carried away sometimes.  Possible?  I'm...  ah, afraid so.
Not exactly.  She was found in a canal, disembowelled.  Throat cut.
Formation of memories is the most important of brain functions.
We are little more than a sum of memories.  From them we reference who we are, where we're going.  Without a past we are nothing.  This is why you are so interesting.
We know of two kinds of memory.
And then there is procedural memory.
Research on simple animals can be...
Listen to me talk!  You must be hungry.
Whole damn wing lost power.  Wiring's old.  Keep meaning to get it fixed.
Ah.  Beautiful!  Head and all!  Just how I like 'em!
I don't blame you for getting angry.
Ah, nearly done.  So tell me about your dreams.  I'm very interested.
Ah, our friends in black...  they are not just a figment of your imagination you know, in fact none of what you are experiencing is anything but real.
I know everything about you.  You have no choice but to trust me.
You can't go yet.  We've got so much to talk about...
You're tired.  You need to lie down.
Yes.  A little something to help you relax.  Harmless...
Damn!  Whoever it is  -  get rid of them!
I'm sorry I had to put you through this, Anton.
There will be some pain, but things will be easier this way.
Listen to what I have to say.  Decide for yourself.
The men in black  -  they're the killers.
If you would only take this, inject it in your brain, everything would be much clearer.
Everyone get's one  -  very much like this...
But this one's special.  It will help you understand, everything...

Anton  -  I mean, John, there has been an experiment, a dangerous experiment.  I arranged it.  It was a lie from the beginning.  It almost worked, but things did not go as they should have.  You have been left  -
You can change this, all this.
Please!  Don't be foolish!  Time is short.  Let me show you something.
Don't ask stupid questions.  Look at it.
Concentrate.  Imagine the syringe rising.  Picture it floating above the table.
No it isn't.  You are doing it!  Now raise it over the glass and...
I'm not certain I fully understand myself...
I  -  ah  -  I...  it's a little cold in here don't you think?
I don't know what you're talking about.
You wouldn't believe me if I told you, Inspector.  Have patience  -
Follow me, and do exactly as I do.
The eye.  Master of time and space!
I had to  -  ahhhh  -  find you...  I..
We are...  living in their dreams...

He's tired, like he hasn't slept.  He's looking at the map stuck to a wall.  There's several neat piles of folders on the kitchen table in front of him.  The kitchen itself is incredibly neat  -  everything completely organized.
Objects float underwater.  They rise upwards amidst bubbles, break the surface.  A storm at sea  -  dismembered BODY PARTS float all the way to the horizon.
He starts to cry.  He puts his head in his hands, his body spasms with each sob.
He's up here!  He raped me!  Hurry!

Bumstead follows inconspicuously.  Without warning, the figure stops and TURNS.  Bumstead backs into a doorway to hide.  He gets a glimpse of the gaunt features of a MYSTERY MAN in the dim light of the alley.
It's the truth...  I need you.  I know you're innocent.
Of course you are.  You couldn't do those terrible things.  Come home with me  -  maybe things will make sense then...
You have an uncle.  You were very close.
This is where he lives. I'm sure he would like to see you.
I can't talk about that.  As long as you understand, that's all.
Pull up some garbage  -  make yourself at home.
They've taken my mind, my memories...
Is that your idea of a joke?  I don't remember...
Take my advice, Bumstead.  Get off this case.  Now.
A few days...  a few weeks  -  dunno, I can't remember.
Worse thing is, I never know if it will change back again...  Now, please leave me alone.
NIGHT OF THE EYE!  NIGHT OF THE EYE!
White moves quietly towards the bedroom door.
I have called this meeting for a purpose, yes?
It is clear to you we are  -
The tuning failed  -  when our agents arrived he was gone.  He knows things -  predicts things.  Explain to us, Doctor.  Why is the situation this way?  Yes?
You said this would be containable!
We must find him.  This is your responsibility.
You have duplicated the personality, yes.
I hear a clock in my head, and I like it!
John White, you are to be tried for murder, yes.  You wish to confess to these crimes now?
Very well.  The testimony of the prosecutors.  Yes.
Something to say?  Ready to confess?
Ah  -  a plot.  Now we have a plot!
A book of delusions.  Anything else?
How dare you use your tricks on me!
Shut up, freak!  Monster!  You are insignificant.
This has all gone too far.  Yes, much too far.
Through the door  -  AN ELEVATOR.  There is only a down button.
Are you alright?  What are you doing here?  Is this one of your jokes, John?  It's been so long, I thought you'd forgotten your uncle Karl?
Not often I get a chance to show these.
And this is me again about  -  um  -  I would guess about twelve feet further to the right of the last shot.  Now just behind the wall is the hotel I stayed at  -  sweet little place...
Look!  This is a good one!
Such a joker!  Like your father.
It must be a closet or something.
Don't trip over.  It's dark up there.
John, I didn't see you there.
Filthy beast!  Shoo!  Go on!  Shoo!
We will teach the pig to meddle in our affairs.  Yes.
Ah, Inspector Bumstead!  We are glad you are here  -  I'm afraid we have done all we can.  Yes.  Your Mother has passed.  Yes.
We are sorry.  The cancer  -  it was fatal.
We no longer make out the figure.  The x-rayed environment resembles some intricate aerial map of the vast city  -  the corridor an ever increasing SPIRAL.
Good as new.  Yes.  Everything is easier now.
White is no more than a SPECK  -  the hall-way stretches ENDLESSLY in both directions, behind and in front of the moving figure, through an infinite labyrinth.
You had your turn!  Let them speak.
Yes, we have a problem here.  Shut it down immediately.
